metadata.title: CVE-2023-52356 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A segment fault (SEGV) flaw was found in libtiff that could be triggered bypassing a crafted tiff file to the TIFFReadRGBATileExt() API. This flawallows a remote attacker to cause a heap-buffer overflow, leading to adenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm15
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm15
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm15
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm15').
texmaker package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
gdal package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
